Sentencas: Chromium poisoning strongly influences the performance of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: A novel numerical model is introduced by incorporating the chemical and electrochemical aspects of chromium poisoning.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: It offers a detailed analysis of the spatial distribution of critical chromium-based species, including SrCrO4 and Cr2O3.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: This model is integrated with a pre-existing three-dimensional, time-dependent computational fluid dynamics (CFD) toolbox, openFuelCell2.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: The numerical simulations indicate a quantitative agreement with experimental data over an extended 100 kh operation.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: Numerical simulations are conducted within a representative channel geometry originating from an F10 SOFC stack at Forschungszentrum Julich GmbH, and consider a wide range of stack designs, temperatures, and air absolute humidities.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: The simulation results demonstrate the potential of a protective coating produced through atmospheric plasma spraying (APS) technology in nearly eliminating chromium poisoning.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack

Sentencas: It is also found that the APS protective coating could enable the operation of an SOFC stack with low requirements of air dehumidification at a temperature of 650 circle C.
Titulo: A Three-Dimensional Time-Dependent Model of the Degradation Caused by Chromium Poisoning in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Stack
